meanings.definition: To provide inadequate service or support to (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: The restaurant would underserve its customers by constantly running out of food.
meanings.sent2: The company should not underserve its clients by ignoring their requests.
meanings.sent3: It would be comical for a chef to underserve a hungry crowd by serving tiny portions.
meanings.sent4: The teacher did not want to underserve her students, so she prepared extra materials for the lesson.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic promised not to underserve the car, ensuring all parts were properly fixed.

meanings.definition: To fail to meet the needs or expectations of (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: The new phone model may underserve users who require advanced features.
meanings.sent2: The company must not underserve its employees by neglecting their training needs.
meanings.sent3: It would be ironic for a superhero to underserve the city by not saving it from danger.
meanings.sent4: The artist did not want to underserve her audience, so she put extra effort into her performance.
meanings.sent5: The chef promised not to underserve the guests, preparing a lavish feast for the event.
